{{Infobox Company | company_name = Ford India Private Limited | company_logo = [[File:Ford Motor Company Logo.svg|200px]] | company_type = [[Subsidiary]] | slogan = Make Every Day Exciting | foundation = October 1995 <small>(as Mahindra Ford India Limited)</small> | location_city = | location_country = | location = [[Chengalpattu]], [[Tamil Nadu]]<ref>[http://www.india.ford.com/servlet/Satellite?c=DFYPage&cid=1178851242607&pagename=wrapper&site=FIPL]</ref> | key_people = Mr. Michael Boneham, [[President]] and [[Managing Director|MD]] | num_employees = 10,000 | industry = [[Automotive]] | products = [[Automobiles]] | parent = [[Ford Motor Company]] | revenue = | net_income = | homepage = [http://www.india.ford.com www.india.ford.com] }} [[Image:Ford-Ikon.jpg|thumb|right|Ford Ikon]] '''Ford India Private Limited''' is a wholly owned subsidiary of the [[Ford Motor Company]] in [[India]]. Ford India Private Limited's head quarters are located in [[Chengalpattu]], [[Chennai]], [[Tamil Nadu]]. It currently is the 6th largest car maker in [[India]] after [[Maruti Suzuki]], [[Hyundai Motor India Limited|Hyundai]], [[Tata Motors|Tata]], [[Mahindra & Mahindra Limited|Mahindra]] and [[Chevrolet Sales India Private Limited|Chevrolet]].
==History== [[Image:New Ford Endeavour.jpg|thumb|right|Ford Endeavour]] [[Image:Ikon1cm3.jpg|thumb|right|Ford Fiesta]]
The modern '''Ford India Private Limited''' began production in 1996, although the roots trace back to 1907 when the [[Ford Model A (1903)|Model A]] was launched. Its manufacturing facilities are in [[Maraimalai Nagar]] near [[Chennai]]. Ford India Private Limited began production in 1926, but was shut down in 1954. Production began again with the joint venture Mahindra Ford India Limited (MFIL) in October 1995, a 50-50 venture with [[Mahindra & Mahindra Limited]]. [[Ford Motor Company]] increased its interest to 72% in March 1998 and renamed the company Ford India Private Limited.<ref name=autogenerated1>[http://business.mapsofindia.com/automobile/car-manufacturers/ford-india.html Ford India Private Ltd, Ford Cars India, Ford Motors India, Ford Fiesta India, Ford in India<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> ===================================
==Corporate Governance== The management team of Ford India comprises Michael Boneham (President & Managing Director), Sandip Sanyal (Executive Director - Operations), Nigel E. Wark (Executive Director, Marketing, Sales and Service), Kuljit Rana (Vice President, Finance & Whole time Director) Vairamani Pandiyan (Vice President, HR).
==Manufacturing Facilities== FIPL's main manufacturing plant has a capacity of 100,000 vehicles annually and is located in [[Maraimalai Nagar]], 45 km from [[Chennai]]. As its new hatchback [[Ford Figo|Figo]] was launched in March 2010,<ref>[http://www.wheelsunplugged.com/ViewNews.aspx?newsid=5509 Ford Figo roll out by March 2010]</ref> [[Ford Motor Company]] has invested $500 million to double capacity of the plant to 200,000 vehicles annually and setting up a facility to make 250,000 engines annually.<ref>[http://www.india.ford.com/servlet/ContentServer?cid=1178851190356&pagename=Page&c=DFYPage&site=FIPL Ford - Virtual Plant Tour]</ref><ref>[http://www.thehindubusinessline.com/2009/02/21/stories/2009022151080300.htm Ford India to export small cars from mid-2010]</ref>

==Sales and Service Network== As of April 2011, FIPL has more than 170 dealerships across 107 cities in 22 [[States of India|states]] and 3 [[Union Territories]] of India.
==Sales Performance== In the year 2010, FIPL recorded sales of 83,887 vehicles against 29,488 vehicles sold during the year 2009 and registered a sales growth of 172%.<ref>[http://www.india.ford.com/servlet/ContentServer?pageid=1178851252772&cid=1248894006798&pagename=FIPL%2FDFYArticle%2FWeb-Standalone&theme=default&direction=ltr&c=DFYArticle&site=FIPL&aldata=||period::20110101,20110331 Ford Records Strong Sales Growth In 2010, Figo Caps The Year With Several Awards]</ref>
==Exports== FIPL currently exports vehicles in limited quantities to South Africa, Nepal, Mexico, Kenya, Bahrain, Angola, Bermuda, Ghana, Iraq, Liberia, Malawi, Madagascar, Mauritius, Nigeria, Senegal, Tanzania, UAE, Zambia and Zimbabwe.<ref>[http://www.autoexpo.in/news_aug10_1.asp Ford India begins bulk export of cars from Chennai]</ref>
